alert.note: Alert for Lower Washington County; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 2:57PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Washington County through 345 PM MST... At 254 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles northwest of Mesquite, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dameron Valley, Gunlock State Park, Ivins, Enterprise, Motoqua, Gunlock, Veyo, Goldstrike and Snow Canyon State Park. This includes Utah Route 18 between mile markers 10 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm will also be capable of producing heavy snowfall, especially above 5000 feet elevation. In addition, this storm will be capable of producing graupel. These frozen precipitation types could lead to areas of slick spots.

area.areaDesc: Lower Washington County; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah
